actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and the Environment.

official_title: To authorize the export of medical devices to countries which have approved such devices.
short_title: Medical Device Export Promotion Act of 1994

summary.text: Medical Device Export Promotion Act of 1994 - Requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services, in administering a specified provision of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, to authorize the export of medical devices which are: (1) intended for export to countries that have a medical device approval process which provides assurances of the safety and effectiveness of such devices; (2) approved under the laws of the country to which they are intended for export; (3) labeled on the outside of the shipping package; and (4) not sold for sale in domestic commerce. Prohibits such exports from being imported into the United States unless approved by the Secretary.

titles.title: Medical Device Export Promotion Act of 1994
To authorize the export of medical devices to countries which have approved such devices.
